website_summaries.verdict: Though it's easy to use and having an extra band can result in higher speeds, the Linksys EA9200 doesn't have enough to justify its over-the-top price tag.
pros: The Linksys AC3200 Tri-Band Smart Wi-Fi EA9200 router has two built-in 5Ghz bands to support both low- and high-end clients without compromising data rates
The router has an easy-to-use interface and helpful remote management features
cons: The router's Wi-Fi range and network storage performance are not as good as you'd expect based on its high price

customer_reviews.title: Proceed with caution.
customer_reviews.text: Pros: I liked that it had two USB ports for external storage. Cons: Constantly needed to be rebooted. Consistently would lose LAN (local area network) connections. Never had an up time longer than two weeks. Died today (installed only eight months ago) in the middle of a client appointment. Very unhappy with this product. UPDATE. Contacted Linksys technical support. Spent over an hour updating firmware, rebooting, and resetting. Tech decided (finally) that the router needed to be replaced. I have to pay for shipping both ways. There is no option for a refund. Good News: The new NETGEAR router purchased as a replacement is running faster than the Linksys ever did and no rebooting constantly.
customer_reviews.author: Travis Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Good unit while it lasts, unfortunately thats not very long
customer_reviews.text: so not happy...ran really well for about 6mos then major drop in radio signal. Firmware updated, rolled back, updated. Channels changed..getting avg 70% radio signal sitting NEXT to router. Drops to 40s 15ft down the hallway. DM all this info to Linksys, they couldnt figure it out. Xfrd me to tech support who called me 3 while I was at work and couldnt answer (also left no call back number or info). Then I get an email saying they are closing the case#...great help. plan on switching to Asus, seem to get better reviews and better support. Not happy with spending $240 for 6mos usage tho
customer_reviews.author: Michael Campanella

customer_reviews.title: ~65 devices connect effortlessly in my 2500 sq/ft house
customer_reviews.text: This thing handles all 65 devices in my home perfectly. I can get service all the way in my garage, all my devices can find the network, and its as fast as my modem can handle (120Mbps). Has more features than I want but I needed it for a device-heavy home with fast internet coming out of the wall. No more range extenders or slow downloads.
customer_reviews.author: Will

customer_reviews.title: You can't get more than 289Mb/s
customer_reviews.text: It is unbelievable that this product made it to market in a completely broken state. The router is stuck at channel 36 on a 20MHz band, regardless of what the actual wireless setting is. (Translation: you're stuck getting 289Mb/s, not 1300Mb/s as promised.). I tried rebooting, changing the channel, disabling the guest account, disabling 2.4Ghz, upgrading the firmware, downgrading the firmware, using the non-US version of the firmware. Nothing changed how this router behaved. Nothing works. Unbelievable. If you value your time, money and network speed, don't buy another linksys router again. My 10 year old router Verizon router is faster than this piece of garbage.
customer_reviews.author: Rob G

customer_reviews.title: Garbage. In theory
customer_reviews.text: Garbage. In theory, this beamforming tri-band super router to the max should work great. Actual usage is pathetic. Continual dropping of anything connected to a 5GHZ bands, making every device I have a brick. Speeds somehow halved using this router as well, dropping from 100mbps to 50. Why? Who knows! When it is connected to a device, the signal strength dies out on 5Ghz far sooner that what my old router now current again router does. Tested out with latest firmware revision. Positive - Super easy setup. I'd be able to give this to my parents and they would be able to figure it out all on their own.
customer_reviews.author: NickisratingstuffonAmazon

customer_reviews.title: Unstable router
customer_reviews.text: I bought this router thinking it could be a good bargain for the price. Any other 3200 router was more expensive and afterall Linksys it a good brand. However, after some day of use I'm completely dissapointed and mad with this equipment. It keeps connecting and disconnecting the devices and I cannot achieve a stable connection for more than 10 minutes. I have reviewed the configuration, resetted the equipment and even updated the firmware without any luck. I live overseas and I cannot return it without expending more money, so I just have a new expensive paperweight with fancy lights. If you wish to have a happy life and enjoy good streaming experience stay away from this product.
customer_reviews.author: Fred

customer_reviews.title: Best router so far
customer_reviews.text: This has been my best wireless router so far. I selected this one because it's powerful which is important for a 3-level townhome. I relocated my internet connection and router to the main level so it's very close to my primary all-in-one PC, tablets, and Fire TV stick for the main tv. Then I use the directional antennae to focus the beam upstairs to another tv with a Fire TV stick, and downstairs to yet another Fire TV stick. Yes, there's still inter-floor attenuation (loss of signal) but not so much as to cause any display buffering. I run this router 24x7 and it doesn't need periodic reboots or any attention really. It's the greatest, especially at $99.
customer_reviews.author: Eludium-Q36

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money.
customer_reviews.text: When it works it seems fine, except I didn't get the better range that I expected for the money. Unfortunately, it is constantly dropping the internet and/or wireless connections. My phone is constantly reporting "Connected/No Internet" and constantly becoming disconnected entirely. I would have possibly blamed it on the phone, but my wife's computer has the same issue using WiFi. I don't see it as often with mine, but I am usually connected directly with wire instead of WiFi. I updated the firmware when I first got it and set it to automatically update, but no new updates have come in. Hoping that Linksys will find and fix the problem with an updated firmware, but I'm losing patience.
customer_reviews.author: YoungS

customer_reviews.title: New AC3200 Router - Nice
customer_reviews.text: Just installed, arrived next day from Amazon, AC3200 TriBand Router Signal seems much better over the previous 2 year old Linksys Wrt AC1900 required the use of an rj45 ethernet cable for me, service provider required authorization on the new router. Config is much the same a s the Linksyssmartwifi UI. It is nice to check setting or reconfig with the SmartWiFi App or URL. Definitely feels and responds faster now for iPhones, iPad, PC's, WiFI DVD Player w/ Internet, and stereo WiFi, Echo's , Thermostat too. Linksys Support was very helpful All in All 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: NeilC

customer_reviews.title: Check your settings to get max performance
customer_reviews.text: Owned this router for ~2 years; but, recently upgraded from 60 Mbps to 400+ Mbps internet and wasn't getting but ~250 Mbps through the router. (note: a good way to check is to connect a laptop direct to your cable modem & measure direct, then connect through the router and measure again). In the router settings, "Connectivity" -> "Administration" - make sure the "Cut Through Forwarding" check box is checked. BAM! full bandwidth through the router. PS: always use good cables, CAT 5e will work, but CAT 6 or CAT 7 will improve your results. Check your speeds using SpeedTest dot net.
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: Horrible
customer_reviews.text: Bought this about a year ago. I had terrible internet where I previously lived and I thought I was losing connection because of the horrible service...NOPE. Moved in to a new place with perfect internet....still doing the same thing. My Galaxy S8 would constantly disconnect and I thought it was the phone. Upgraded to the Note 9, same thing. I finally decided to try the cable company's STOCK router, and it worked flawlessly. Not only have I not had any trouble with connection, I have also downloaded at almost 3X speed. This was supposed to be for gaming??? I will never buy another Linksys product again.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Wescott

customer_reviews.title: Not impressed
customer_reviews.text: Less than impressed. My older Linksys AC1900 has much better signal strength than this one did. I tried it out in a couple different locations and it just couldn't provide good coverage or speeds. And then I tried to set this thing up as a wireless bridge, only to discover it can't be used as a wireless bridge. Shame on me for not checking that in the first place. If you have a small home or apartment I guess it would be okay. If you have a 2,000 sq ft house or bigger then your better off with a more robust router.
customer_reviews.author: Alex Hall

customer_reviews.title: Powerful router, gets to all three floors of my home. Super easy to set up, fantastic support from Linksys.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product backed by superb service. I have been buying Linksys routers for home use for years and I keep on getting them because of the amazing quality of their support, which has been consistently like this for years. I have six Linksys routers, and this one is a step above. I have attached an external drive (WD MyBook 3TB drive) which I use to stream movies and music, and it works seamlessly and easily. The wifi on this is outstanding. I have a three-story home, with all sorts of interferences, and the signal reaches strongly to all parts of the house. Most impressive.
customer_reviews.author: JB

customer_reviews.title: Good product, had a hiccup, but works well.
customer_reviews.text: The AC3200 arrived and was easy to setup straight from the box. I began to customize the settings to match my environment, turning off DHCP, allowing my internal server to handle this role - once this was done the mobile application could no longer be used for setup. I discovered this was due to the local ip information not storing the DNS server information any longer, as it did not need to hand it out. Fortunately I don't need to use the application to maintain the device. Disconnects on standard equipment are rare, if they happen at all, with it currently maintaining more than 20 wireless devices, and 20 wired devices..
customer_reviews.author: The Doctor

customer_reviews.title: Constantly breaks connections
customer_reviews.text: The wifi is constantly dropping the connection. It reconnects quickly, but it causes all kinds of problems when it happens (for instance, I just tried to pay a bill online and it dropped the connection just as I hit confirm. I have no idea if it paid). I often have to disconnect from wifi and use my cellular service so that I can maintain a constant connection. Rebooting the router helps for a day or two, but no more.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew

customer_reviews.title: Did not last long
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install and worked fine 1st two months. Thought it was my internet modem when it started dropping out and reloading on tv and had a hard time getting my smart phones to connect. I turned out to be the Linkseys router. Did not call Linkseys. I should have read the reviews. Seems this router has a problem and most people did not get a fix. By the time the problem showed up it was too late to return. I had to go back to my 8 year old Linkseys modem. I wanted a faster modem. Well you live and learn. I don't give bad reviews very easy because I can usually fix the problem.
customer_reviews.author: wbran49626

customer_reviews.title: Good price and good performance.
customer_reviews.text: I had no problem so far with this router, I have upgraded from Netgear AC1900 model dual band and it's a big step up. My main reason for upgrade was buffering problem, when I switched to AC3200 there was a little buffering when watching videos although I think it's based on the distance of the router from the modem or the tv. For gaming this model is good although there is also AC5400 that is build for that. This model is about $50 less expensive than Linksys AC2200.
customer_reviews.author: Primemember83

customer_reviews.title: this is a great high-end router for the price
customer_reviews.text: I have a very device heavy home with a lot of cable splitting and this device handles all of it with ease. Range is moderate; it doesn't broadcast quite as far as other routers I've had but when in range the wireless speeds are fast. The only reason I'm giving 4-stars is because of the dual 5GHz band. My wireless devices would constantly switch between the two bands and subsequently disconnect entirely, having to connect to the 2.4GHz band. I returned and replaced and ended up with the same issue, however, splitting the dual 5GHz band into two separate bands has resolved this issue. Overall, this is a great high-end router for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Evan Leindecker

customer_reviews.title: Poor connection
customer_reviews.text: Having a Gig pipe for speed, I found my bottleneck and cause of my connectivity issues, and your reading the review for the product that causes it. Randomly, devices can't access the internet and/or packets are dropped. Switched to a different router, no issues. While the description say designed for Device-Heavy Homes, even my Echos and G-home lose connectivity with the internet via this router. Having to cycle the router every few days is just old now. Was supposed to have been upgraded due to the issues, and after 8 months, I still have the same router. Ended up just buying a new one and saying Good-Bye to Linksys
customer_reviews.author: Aaron Peterson

customer_reviews.title: Waste of time...
customer_reviews.text: Doesn't come with instructions. Found instructions online. Instructions say to connect to the network on the quick start card, but it didn't come with a quick start card. I found the network, but it needs a password. I assume that would have been on the quick start card. Waste of time... Update: I finally got it to work and it worked for about 5 months... Now you have to unplug it and plug it back in at least twice a day. Big piece of junk.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Schleimer

customer_reviews.title: Not good
customer_reviews.text: Not a stable wifi router. Sucks! Update... downgraded to 1 star. I have wasted enough time with this thing. The only part of my house with inconsistent or non-existent wifi is the half covered by this router. In this day of smart home technology, nothing is worse than having to get up to reset the router just to turn off lights!
customer_reviews.author: EW

customer_reviews.title: Wired connection is slower than wired
customer_reviews.text: Loved this router until my internet speed went up. Now after some trouble shooting I can get the advertised speed on wireless, but less than half on wired. I spent 2 hours trolling the forums and tried everything I ran across with no change in wired speed. So if your internet speed is greater than 75Mbs then don't waste your time.... Unless I got a defective unit, but it's way outside warranty now
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Tri-band gigabit router. Not everyone needs this tier of router though
customer_reviews.text: Covers a vast area of my home, penetrates walls effectively, blazing fast speeds. If you manage your home network, and you have an idea of where you'd put this beast, you'll love it, just go ahead and buy it. I have noticed it tends to drown out weaker APs in adjacent rooms, but what do you expect lol If you aren't knowledgeable about your home network, this is probably overkill.
customer_reviews.author: Shishir Tandale

customer_reviews.title: Really powerful with the extender/ Phone assistance saves the day.
customer_reviews.text: This was not a naturally friendly Apple product nevertheless I bought it because it had several good reviews of the phone tech assistance. When I opened it I was stuck in no time. Even though it was well past midnight their phone assistance was very helpful in helping me to complete the setup. They had a service for another $20 where they would do it by remote. I'd paid a pretty penny for this so I opted to have them coach me. It works way better than my old Airport Extreme.
customer_reviews.author: Dave G.

customer_reviews.title: Not really impressed
customer_reviews.text: Many of the items work very well on the wireless network. However all the iPhones and iPads time out and disconnect from the network. The parental controls sort of work. For example, sometimes I cannot access the router controls, other times I can after entering my user name and password multiple times. And despite restricting the child's computer on the internet they are still able to access certain sites and can access Youtube without any problems
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Avoid this Product
customer_reviews.text: This modem works well for the lower speed devices but if drops iPhone and iPad devices on the 5 gig ac wifi. You have to disconnect and reconnect the wifi frequently which is a pain. I'll be purchasing a different brand. Update 1/2018: the exorcism is finally compete - I removed this modem from my house and have it in the e-waste pile to trash. This is the last Linksys product I will ever buy and was a total waste of money. It just constantly dropped WiFi. Demons be gone!
customer_reviews.author: Mud Trudgers

customer_reviews.title: Unstable 5 Ghz
customer_reviews.text: DO NOT BUY THIS PRODUCT. It is very unstable at 5 Ghz ... you will more than likely experience regular drop outs. If you call there help line... they are of virtually zero help. Certainly a disappointment when switching from another router (thinking I was upgrading).
customer_reviews.author: Serious Buyer

customer_reviews.title: Garbage
customer_reviews.text: Worked great until it did a firmware update, secondary 5ghz channel wouldnt work, getting 300 megabytes download on hardline and 25 megabytes on wifi lol,, horrible... even rolled back firmware and that didnt work. No wonder it was only 100 bucks, piece of trash. Do not buy this hunk of coal.
customer_reviews.author: proud2teech

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work for me.
customer_reviews.text: Constant dropped wifi. Had to shut off and on wifi on devices constantly. Returned after a week's use. Not what I hoped for.
customer_reviews.author: Jawabba

customer_reviews.title: Good for small spaces
customer_reviews.text: Worked fine with short distances, but its range fell short in a medium suburban home. It should be fine for having a lot of devices in an apartment. I eventually replaced it with a WRT 3200 that was much better, but more expensive.
customer_reviews.author: Sunny Jim

customer_reviews.title: Meh, I’m not impressed, yet
customer_reviews.text: Not the easiest to set up. It takes 20-30 minutes minimum for it to update the firmware and software out of the box. I contacted Linksys to get help with set up. I was hoping to use my previous Linksys router settings and simply transfer them over. This was apparently a difficult task for the chat tech. I eventually got it setup. So far, it has a great range. We’ll see how it works.
customer_reviews.author: The Gov & First Lady

customer_reviews.title: If you want to upgrade, go bigger.
customer_reviews.text: Had a linksys router for 5 years, got my moneys worth, but speeds weren’t as fast as I wanted. Upgraded to this model. Tested speeds before, and after, and very little improvement. I’d say between 15-25 Mbps increase. Might work well for others, just not me unfortunately. Recently changed to the velop system and wireless speeds tripled. Look there for quality WiFi.
customer_reviews.author: Alan

customer_reviews.title: I find interface provides useful information even though finding where to go to change ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this router to replace an dying WRT610N. Setup was a breeze. I find interface provides useful information even though finding where to go to change a particular setting can have you hopping from tab to tab until you get use to the interface. I also find it odd that the gauge for the speed test only goes to 20 Mbps when the router is capable of 1Gbps. Also, with the claim of penta-core processing power why does it take so long to save changes or reboot the router.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth

customer_reviews.title: Simple setup fast performance!
customer_reviews.text: This is the best wireless router I have ever had , there is a smart option for choosing the wireless network if you check the box for that option it will automatically disconnect and reconnect to a different network with a better signal since this router has 3 simultaneous wirless bands , use the mobile app to setup your router it's the easiest setup process I had to do in my entire life 5 out of 5 , this is currently the cheapest AC 3200 router you can buy.
customer_reviews.author: GEE

customer_reviews.title: Was good for almost a year..
customer_reviews.text: It was not easy to install but it worked better than its predecessors now it decided to stop working wirelessly. I have 2 desktops plugged into it and they work fine. Rebooted Router and is now asking for a password that I know but will not take it.
customer_reviews.author: bdcool6

customer_reviews.title: I would highly recommend avoiding this device as there are several other capable ...
customer_reviews.text: I've owned this device for over two years now and I've been having problems with it since day one. I've kept the firmware up to date with the latest released but it has proven to be consistently unreliable. After a while any device that is connected to it will lose connectivity until you disable and re-enable the wifi on it. This includes two cell phones, my personal and work laptops, my girlfriend's Macbook, and my tablet. I would highly recommend avoiding this device as there are several other capable devices on the market for a much better price.
customer_reviews.author: Lance Stringham

customer_reviews.title: A real  Wi-Fi Intrface
customer_reviews.text: Certainly a very easy yo set up and us device. My computers and portable media were an easy process to pair with this unit. Both cable and wireless networks interfaces are being used simultaneously. Effortless reset it self after a power outage.
customer_reviews.author: patton00

customer_reviews.title: If it had not been for Linksys excellent customer support
customer_reviews.text: Didn't know that they were selling me an old router. Had to do 4 firmware updates before I could set it up. If it had not been for Linksys excellent customer support, I would have sent it back!
customer_reviews.author: John In Chattanooga, TN

customer_reviews.title: Average router, was hoping for range improvement over wireless N
customer_reviews.text: I was expecting some appreciable difference in range after upgrading from my wireless N router to this unit, but there is none at all. In fact, there is a lower signal in some areas of my home using this router. I have yet to notice any increase in speed from the beam forming. I know a lot depends on the limitations on data transfer from the carrier, but even my ac enables devices aren't getting any benefit from this router. This is a very average router.
customer_reviews.author: IWannaTalkToSamson

customer_reviews.title: BEWARE USELESS PAPERWEIGHT
customer_reviews.text: JUST WANT TO SAY, I BOUGHT THIS, USED IT FOR BARELY A YEAR, AND THIS THING BECAME A USELESS PAPERWEIGHT. LINKSYS WONT SERVICE/REPAIR/REPLACE IT BECAUSE SURE ENOUGH IT'S OUT OF IT'S 1YR WARRANTY WINDOW. I DON'T KNOW HOW THESE COMPANIES DO IT, BUT THEY BUILD THIS GARBAGE TO BARELY LAST THEIR WARRANTIES AND SURE ENOUGH, THEY BECOME PAPERWEIGHTS THAT CAN'T EVEN HANDLE ROUTING INTERNET FROM A MODEM TO ONE WIRE CONNECTED WORKSTATION EVEN. TRUE GARBAGE.
customer_reviews.author: John L.

customer_reviews.title: How Incredibly Durable
customer_reviews.text: This unit is incredibly durable, akin to a tank compared with other equipment. The case is well built and is strong. The antennas cover all of my home, with no dead spots. I have compared this unit with all the other routers that I've purchased and found it to be the best overall. Thank you Linksys.
customer_reviews.author: Don E.

customer_reviews.title: I was very disappointed with this purchase
customer_reviews.text: I had a lot of problems with this router. I brought this router for the WIFI security cameras I purchased. I had so many problems, I finally decided to go back to my old router and buy a booster for my router. So, now this expensive router is just sitting on my head post collecting dust. It doesn't have enough functional capabilities to allow the use to have more control on what it uses and how it uses it. I was very disappointed with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Cheryl Green

customer_reviews.title: Great product. Upgraded from an older n1900
customer_reviews.text: Great product. Upgraded from an older n1900, and this router easily outpaces it. We have up to 5 wireless devices streaming and two hard wired computers streaming at the busiest time of day, and it performs flawlessly. But I was really after greater range and this delivers there too. Mounted it up high in the middle of the house there are no dead zones in the house, and can still stream out at the mailbox, and it's much, much cheaper for the high end routers, but with the same technology. One of the best buys around.
customer_reviews.author: Chris R.

customer_reviews.title: Once you update the firmware and make the tweaks it rocks!!
customer_reviews.text: Firmware was out of date with a bad version installed. Once I figured out how to put the latest firmware on it and change the auto channel to 6 and rename the 2.4 ghz to _2.4ghz the router was staying connected with no drop outs and cranking down 194MBs!
customer_reviews.author: William G Lewis

customer_reviews.title: Automated setup can be tedious, otherwise a great router
customer_reviews.text: I had to deal with a very bad technical support person to get the setup completed, but once I could access the device everything regarding the setup went well and fast. Now the device is deployed and working wonderfully.
customer_reviews.author: NanoBot1962

customer_reviews.title: USB does not work
customer_reviews.text: Router is not easy to install, specifically USB printer does not work. USB Control Center does not recognize any USB device connected to router. I will try to troubleshoot the issue or I will return it. Tried to insyall printer and other usb devices, but router's usb ports do not works. I will teturn the router.
customer_reviews.author: Handyman1711

customer_reviews.title: AC3200 WiFi Router.
customer_reviews.text: Easy setup, works well with a lot of simultaneous connections. Gave me the speed increase over WiFi and stopped my dropped connection problems. I have not tested the 5 GHz band as I have no 5 Ghz capable devices.. Speedtest.net gave it 64.5 Mbps over 2.4 GHz and I get 107 Mbps wired. I am supposing that using the 5 GHz band will allow maximum possible WiFi speed. This device has 3 adjustable external antennas and 3 internal antennas. My only objection is the relatively large size of it.
customer_reviews.author: Paul A. Franz, P.E.

customer_reviews.title: Didn't last one year
customer_reviews.text: Spent a little extra hoping for a better router .... this wasn't it. Worked OK for perhaps the first six months, then started to require regular restarts. From the outset, signal strength was poor. Only 2400 sq foot house ..... and signal was weak in back bedroom and loft. Just over one year old and the thing completely died.
customer_reviews.author: C

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Router, so far
customer_reviews.text: Excellent Router, so far. Substancial jump from my old AC1200 router. Had to reset the router during the initial setup, even though the quickstart instructions didn't say to do this. Other than that, all is crazy fast and good. No dropped connections, and good signal throughout the house. I'd buy this router again. This router is clearly targeted towards the mainstream consumer and not a networking geek that desires varying exotic router configurations.
customer_reviews.author: V. Scott

customer_reviews.title: Looks like this is the router for me!
customer_reviews.text: This router was a breeze to set up. We have a difficult house to get good wifi through the really thick walls . I had an older single band linksys and tried to replace it another brand that I could not get to hook up to the internet. I returned it and went back to the brand that I knew worked for me previously Linksys. The installation was painless and as of this moment, I have wifi thru the entire house. All running at the same time are 2 laptops, 2 smart tvs, 3 kindle fires and one kindle paperwhite, Looks like this is the router for me!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I canwatch 1080p videos with no problems/buffering
customer_reviews.text: I have it buried on my desk behind my monitor and XBox at about 30 in off the floor. It goes thru 6 walls in 30 feet to reach the laptop in another room. The laptop (Dell Insprion Series 5000) performs the same if it was 5 in from the router or the 30 ft both @ 72.5 Mbps. I can watch 1080p videos with no problems/buffering. I have Cox premium internet. I download @ 117 Mbps, upload @ 12.5 Mbps, latency is 8 ms, and router speed is 1.0Gbps on my desktop.
customer_reviews.author: PR1AWRet

customer_reviews.title: The Linksys setup is very easy, even though I like to customize my network
customer_reviews.text: The Linksys setup is very easy, even though I like to customize my network, the GUI makes it a SNAP! Great tools and awesome throughput for multiple streaming devices, and covers a very large area and even multiple floors in my house. I also like the upright design, allowing better cooling for optimal operation. If you are upgrading your router (mine was 8 years old), you should seriously consider this router!!
customer_reviews.author: JULIE & JERRY KONTUR

customer_reviews.title: What a disappointment this router has been
customer_reviews.text: What a disappointment this router has been. iOS devices are a constant headache and connections are spotty at best. I used to by cisco products for all my setups, but I wont be in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Noble Spaniard

customer_reviews.title: I like the interface and feature set for this router
customer_reviews.text: I like the interface and feature set for this router. It is fast and handles a house with more than 25 devices connecting to it with no issues. I wish the range were a little better on it; I've set up a repeater to ensure good signal strength throughout the house. Before that, streaming was very iffy upstairs. The only other thing I would like to see is DD-WRT support, for those of us that like to tweak settings and exercise maximum control over our networks.
customer_reviews.author: R. Brown

customer_reviews.title: Great router for network and streaming video and protection
customer_reviews.text: Very good router. It has great signal strength and reach. I can connect to my network from my neighbors house across t b email street with my Samsung tablet. Has great security features that you can adjust and it allows you to give more bandwidth to certain items like flat screen streaming video
customer_reviews.author: Mikey

customer_reviews.title: there are much better options for cheaper
customer_reviews.text: For the price this router isn't great or even good. It actually preforms slower than my asus dual band router (tm-ac1900), so if i were in the need of a dual or tri band router this is not the way I would go, however I decided to keep it and use it as a wifi extender for the parts of my house that don't get signal. The only reason I kept it was the fact that I got it on a lightning deal for $140, otherwise I would have sent it back.
customer_reviews.author: joe arnold

customer_reviews.title: Not impressed
customer_reviews.text: Been using Linksys for years. My old ones were just not built for today's speeds.. bought this one... which was more expensive than most.. not seeing much difference in the old ones. Says... Gig speeds.. haven't attained that at all. Have 200 Meg at modem.. and 80-90 meg on the other side of this router... no matter Wifi.. 2.4 or 5.0 or wired... not much difference. Disappointed in overall product that it's like a bottleneck with switching for this router.
customer_reviews.author: Michael J. Peterson

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: The wireless devices were not getting a network connection, but anything wired was.
customer_reviews.author: Cecilia Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Linksys AC3200 Tri-Band Smart Wi-Fi Router
customer_reviews.text: It's a good router but the improvement isn't much better than my 6 year old Cisco-Linksys WRT610N Simultaneous Dual-N Band Wireless Router. My family uses a lot of wireless devices and the WRT610N handled everything this new router can handle. This router was easier to set up but the old router wasn't that hard to set up. The improvement which I haven't seen especially range wise just wasn't worth upgrading from my old router.
customer_reviews.author: Red Wolfe

customer_reviews.title: ROUTER FAILED - Again...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this router and it failed in less than 6 months. I received a second router thanks to Amazon but sadly this one failed 13 months after receiving it,1 month after the warranty expired. Linksys will not stand behind their products after warranty and they don't seem to last. Buy from another manufacturer - AVOID LINKSYS.
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: Changed our streaming lives . . .
customer_reviews.text: This router has worked great in our household. We rely on internet service for TV streaming, a security system, 2 iphones, and an iPad. Since switching to this router we have had no interruptions in streaming. In addition, the router comes with an app that is so easy to use to set passwords and choose which devices stream on each of the 3 bands. If you don't have the place for an app, there is also a website that is user-friendly to manage.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren A.

customer_reviews.title: Somehow router keeps dropping signal or the internet connection. ...
customer_reviews.text: Somehow router keeps dropping signal or the internet connection. Also experienced connection speed very slow and after a restart it comes back normally for a while. And according to my findings I am not alone with this behavior. Either Linksys has to deliver a new firmware or it is a hardware problem
customer_reviews.author: Humberto Giuntoli

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality. Doesn't last
customer_reviews.text: Terrible product. Wireless has been going down non-stop. 5ghz guest networked stopped transmitting. I've had this for less than a year. I am out 180 bucks (yes, I bought high). No more linksys/belkin routers for me. I remember when they used to be leading edge.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Dale

customer_reviews.title: Drops signal constantly!
customer_reviews.text: The router drops all of our devices constantly. It's awful. We are always having to reconnect all of our devices.
customer_reviews.author: Chad Clark

customer_reviews.title: Linksys AC3200 Tri-Band Smart Wi-Fi Router
customer_reviews.text: Linksys has done it again!! Although some of the menus have changed, it was not an issue looking them up or figuring it out. This is the best home/small office wireless router and has excellent range. I use this in a 4600sf house upstairs in a closet, and can get a good wireless signal all over and even out on the back patio.
customer_reviews.author: The Ghost

customer_reviews.title: Very Stable and Fast Router
customer_reviews.text: I had a small linksys router in the past eating dust but never missed a beat . After reading all the reviews I went with a Netgear router but ended up returning that any buying this one. Since then , and 2 years later today , I have not faced any issues with this router.
customer_reviews.author: Vikas

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY!!
customer_reviews.text: I was concerned when buying this due to users stating they were having WiFi drops. I was willing to buy it as my my main connection need was going to be wired to the Linksys. Well starting on the 30th (yesterday) mt wired computer started dropping off the internet. I chalked it up to an Internet issue. Well the same thing is happening today. I disconnected the wired connection, connected to my non-LinkSys WiFi and have not dropped a packet for 2 hours. So long story short, this is a piece of junk and DO NOT waste you money
customer_reviews.author: Adriona J Striolw

customer_reviews.title: Signal Went From Almost Nothing to Better Than Great
customer_reviews.text: Our Wi-Fi went from 3 to 25. We can stream anything we want. The router is even in a different room. And we still got a much much better signal.
customer_reviews.author: rrjwj

customer_reviews.title: It disconnects from the network too often
customer_reviews.text: It keeps disconnecting. I got to push the off button at least every other day. Set up was a little cumbersome. I feel is two pricey for these issues.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love the HW, Hate the SW
customer_reviews.text: Pros: - Wide range provided. - Mobile app to manage the router and smart setup wizard make it easier for non-IT users to configure the device. - Introduced new features like network prioritization/management, etc... Cons: - Difficult to set as Access Point comparing to the previous models. - There are many advanced options missed in the new smart setup wizard.
customer_reviews.author: bo_qbqb

customer_reviews.title: Works, but has same basic flaw as others
customer_reviews.text: "Good neighbor" power reduction reduces usefulness... Should be possible to override to fixed power. Generally works better than device it replaced.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Drops connection several times a day.
customer_reviews.text: Drops/loses connection several times a day for about 30 seconds to 1 minute and it comes back up. However, Mac Book computer and iPhone need to have wifi turned off an on to get it to work again. The wife hates this router. And I bought the most expensive router I could find because I didn't want to have any issues. Unbelievable in this day and age.
customer_reviews.author: C. Rodriguez

customer_reviews.title: Awesome piece of hardware!
customer_reviews.text: I liked this router a lot and really wanted to keep it but the guest settings available were not sufficient for my needs. I have family and extended family that come over often but I don't want to have them on the main network. This router's guest network requires the person getting on it to open up a web page to accept every time you need to get on the guest network in which my other router does not. Sadly, this was the deciding factor for me in returning it but other than that, speed and reception was exceptional.
customer_reviews.author: Zee

customer_reviews.title: YOU WANT THIS!
customer_reviews.text: I moved by office and left an older Linksys AC WiFi router there for the other tenant. This upgrade to the newer model is fantastic!
customer_reviews.author: H. LUBERT

customer_reviews.title: I thought this would be a wonderful upgrade. Wrong
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this router to replace a 3 or 4 year old router I thought was struggling to handle all the devices on the network. Given this router's features, I thought this would be a wonderful upgrade. Wrong! Out of the box it sets up just fine and things kick off ok, but in no time, smart phone struggle to keep the connection alive (iphones in particular seem to have to constantly reset their wifi connection to the router), video streaming is now much worse than with the older router, and connection speeds in general are suffering. Not pleased at all, especially for the money paid. I would not recommend this router to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: M. George

customer_reviews.title: I fully expect it to last many many years.
customer_reviews.text: This was a replacement. If a power surge hadn't had taken my first one out it probably would have lasted till technology required a new one. Barring lighting, etc.I fully expect it to last many many years.
customer_reviews.author: Griff Evans

customer_reviews.title: Great router that increases internet speed
customer_reviews.text: I was replacing an older router which was slow. Since I was using an direct ethernet connection, I thought the router was just a passthrough and would not affect download speeds. Wrong! This router really increased the speed fourfold. While the wireless speed is slower than a direct ethernet connection, it also was faster than the old router. It was easy to set up worked right away. I'm very satisfied with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: glh3

customer_reviews.title: The set up was easy and it work well
customer_reviews.text: The Linksys AC3200 was purchased to replace another Linksys system. The set up was easy and it work well, currently I run four computers and two tablets as well as my android phone without any issues. When I have had guess I have as many as 15 devices on the network without any issues. Great Router, I would recommend this purchase. I have not had any issues with dropping when streaming movies on the net.
customer_reviews.author: Brawley_Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The best feature is that at no point in its service ...
customer_reviews.text: If you can afford this, get it. There is no need to buy something less than this except for monetary reasons. It is very very capable at all of its functions. The best feature is that at no point in its service run has it needed to be turned off, unplugged, or reset. It just keeps doing its job like its supposed to.
customer_reviews.author: Evan Stapp

customer_reviews.title: Good, not great.
customer_reviews.text: Great router, but has its flaws. Pros: -Good AC coverage -Simple UI -Good customer support -Large enough to entertain the kids Cons: -Connection and data consistency issues -Smart Wifi switching needs an update. Very unstable -Price a bit high for what it delivers.
customer_reviews.author: Pete Giron

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy
customer_reviews.text: 6 months after purchase dropped connections about. No open source options available either, so now I have a $100 brick that sometimes offers Wi-Fi connections.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: So far this router is working well. I am always afraid of Linksys products. Sometime they turn out to be excellent and other time very crappy. Their support team is far from good and I hate having to deal with them.
customer_reviews.author: M

customer_reviews.title: In My Opinion after a few months of Testing NOT WORK FOR THE MONEY
customer_reviews.text: i buy this router to get stability and Velocity to the maximum expression and i only get Velocity *.* because every 2 days drop all connection and i need to turn off & on, i think maybe is a firmware problem but no any new firmware . i feel sad because i lost my money with this buy
customer_reviews.author: Giovanni Tornillo

customer_reviews.title: A great upgrade to my network making TV streaming a joy ...
customer_reviews.text: Still going strong many months after purchase. A great upgrade to my network making TV streaming a joy in every room! Cut the cable, go streaming services!
customer_reviews.author: Brian M. Watson

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: Works as advertised. Solved my problem of too many wireless devices online for my old overwhelmed router.
customer_reviews.author: Rob H.

customer_reviews.title: This router resolved all the Wi-Fi issues in my home with buffering and connecting easily throughout my house
customer_reviews.text: No complaints other than the price... This router resolved all the Wi-Fi issues in my home with buffering and connecting easily throughout my house. Installation was simple and straightforward. The adjustable antennas needed a little tweaking for upstairs and far corners of the house, but that only took a day or so. Since we use a Roku Play and several laptops, tablets, and cell phones the multiple co-processors and high throughput probably are a big plus.
customer_reviews.author: SNesbit2

customer_reviews.title: Won't keep the connection
customer_reviews.text: This router is fast and easy to set up and use but it drops all the time and I have to reconnect every time I want to use the internet. I love the interface but it's going back.
customer_reviews.author: Amber

customer_reviews.title: Great quality and value- interface is great too
customer_reviews.text: The setup, and console is great and easy to use but not totally dumbed down, helpful if you're comfortable with what your doing.
customer_reviews.author: Ohio

customer_reviews.title: Good router, can handle a bunch of units...
customer_reviews.text: Can handle a heavy load... Has some weak signal areas in parts of the house... Reliable, easy setup...
customer_reviews.author: Ray Z

customer_reviews.title: Good, when it works...
customer_reviews.text: This router works great for wired connections. Wireless is slow and not constant. Even with all the "smart" features turned off, this router still slows down devices speeds to a halt. I'm constantly have to disconnect and reconnect my devices. I'm and IT professional and I've done all the troubleshooting I can. Returning this and getting an Asus router.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Disconnects and need to reboot 3-4 times a day
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this router for few months now. This routers some how needs reboot 3-4 times a day. The range is also not good as it cannot cover just 900 sq ft apartment. I would never recommend anyone buying this router.
customer_reviews.author: Tapan

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Excellent Excellent linksys support and they are very highly TRUSTWORTHY
customer_reviews.text: Excellent Excellent Excellent! Easily handles up to 25 devices on router. Has WIFI signal for long distance for big houses use and very little to no signal loss in my house. I have gone thorugh a lot of routers and I am very pleased with this one. I highly recommend it to anyone having problems with a big house WIFI signal loss in their house to buy this one and use it easily without any problems
customer_reviews.author: gammoneer

customer_reviews.title: Worked pretty good the first month
customer_reviews.text: Worked pretty good the first month, but went down hill from there. I'm a big on Linksys for their easy interface and setup, but support was horrible on all sides ( Amazon, Linksys, and the extended warranty). My review is based on this router, I'm still waiting on my replacement from Linksys.
customer_reviews.author: KnightOne

customer_reviews.title: Problems solved!!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent router, the cable guy came when we moved and he said this is a great router too!! We were having problems with multiple devices and streaming in our home and this device fixed everything
customer_reviews.author: Marylin Curiel

customer_reviews.title: Easy to setup
customer_reviews.text: Easy to setup, informative user manual, many features and easy to set up, significantly improved my internet to my devices, impressive professional look of the product. Great value for dollar.
customer_reviews.author: C. W.

customer_reviews.title: Wish I had purchased something like our last Lindsys that lasted a good 5 years
customer_reviews.text: This was supposed to be the end all of all routers when we purchased it. Now it needs viagra cuz it just can't stay up a few days without rebooting mutiple times a day. Wish I had purchased something like our last Lindsys that lasted a good 5 years. I can NOT recommend this to anyone... in fact I'd steer away. I've done all the "firmware upgrades" and still it just can't stay up for very long. Hate IT!
customer_reviews.author: Todd-Dimmitt

customer_reviews.title: Speedy router
customer_reviews.text: The speed this thing puts out is GREAT! The tri-band makes it so you aren't sharing bandwidth as much. I think sometimes the reception isn't as good as I would like. However, it gets out of my home, and into my yard. I am using it in conjunction with Xfinity's router/gateway--which I had been using as my router. I would never go back.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Mckay

customer_reviews.title: easy install and set up
customer_reviews.text: no dead zones, 3 bands to work with, easy install and set up.
customer_reviews.author: Stelio Kontos

customer_reviews.title: Amazing distance and supplier of numerous devices.
customer_reviews.text: Works flawlessly for my family of five. Supplies five TV's, multiple tablets and phones, an Xbox One X and does this without any problems. My house is also pretty long and the Router reaches all of them and even when we outside.
customer_reviews.author: sammy

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it
customer_reviews.text: Ok maybe two stars.... but not really. I have a 2000 sqft home and my router was in one corner downstairs. My bedroom is upstairs in the opposite corner and basically I couldn't connect to the 5 Ghz network... if it connected to the 2.4 it was slow and overall it would just randomly reset my wifi connection sometimes. Once I bought a different router with basically the same specifications the problem went away. Really, don't buy it unless you live in a small loft.
customer_reviews.author: DMarVel

product_meta.title: Linksys AC3200 Tri-Band Smart Wi-Fi Router with Gigabit and USB, Designed for Device-Heavy Homes, Smart Wi-Fi App Enabled to Control Your Network from Anywhere (EA9200)
product_meta.description: The Linksys AC3200 Tri-Band Smart Wi-Fi Router is designed for device-heavy homes with simultaneous wireless activities. Tri-band technology adds an additional high-speed 5 GHz band for combined speeds of up to 3.2 Gbps - up to double the AC performance of dual-band routers. Innovative Smart Connect technology optimizes the performance of your wireless devices by balancing them across multiple Wi-Fi bands. Its six active antennas - 3 external, 3 internal - provide six data streams and a 1 GHz dual-core CPU ensures faster combined Wi-Fi speeds to even more devices without diminishing individual speed or performance. Four Gigabit ports offer a blazing-fastest wired connection, while Beamforming technology focuses and strengthens the Wi-Fi signal to your Wireless-AC devices.
feature_bullets: 1 GHz dual-core CPU and 3 integrated co-processors deliver 2.96GHz of penta-core processing power
Linksys Smart Wi-Fi software with Network Map
Platform Compatibility: Windows XP,Vista 32/64, 7 32/64, 8 32/64,8.1 32/64, 10 32/64 Mac OS X 10.5.8 Leopard, 10.6.1 Snow Leopard, X 10.7 Lion, 10.8 Mountain Lion,10.9 Mavericks

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.8 out of 5 stars870 ratings3.8 out of 5 stars
